intro: Brassica juncea var. crispifolia, commonly known as curled mustard, is a variety of the mustard plant characterized by its distinctive curled leaves. It is an annual herb native to Asia and is often cultivated for its edible leaves and seeds. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small yellow flowers in the spring. Its leaves are rich in nutrients and have a spicy, pungent flavor similar to other mustard varieties. This plant thrives in cool climates and is often used in traditional cuisines and as a forage crop.
